alert.note: Alert for Holmes (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 6:30PM EDT until August 12 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR HOLMES COUNTY... At 630 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Millersburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Millersburg, Berlin, Walnut Creek, Killbuck, Holmesville, Glenmont, Nashville, Winesburg, Farmerstown, Baltic, Mount Hope and Charm. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Ohio. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
